intro: Tephrosia sulphurea, commonly known as golden tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in warm climates.
